intro: Kemulariella tuganiana, commonly known as the Tuganian kemulariella, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
